
Alice used RSA but picked both primes as Blum integers. Can you recover her secret and decrypt the message? Here is the ciphertext: 5504326156926183366080132740115701374147210445880076882330753030124979083172782222300409936413479183994175608389543738177836017438614610884211134355938130


The flag format is flag{...}
n=6859174111435024510253421458680580259305094517098660804606158438592136708158321412185041426653997630059019001207711621733917999683298965392169896958458913, e=1549488705476755014685333785545000381192222346676781233278311597142241666289339426473410564955539491634817589632730685079191456830106121768568069422532869
The lower 104 bits of p are: 72499552220612223376036046530858764171


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{xjicr2b8}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 5504326156926183366080132740115701374147210445880076882330753030124979083172782222300409936413479183994175608389543738177836017438614610884211134355938130
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6859174111435024510253421458680580259305094517098660804606158438592136708158321412185041426653997630059019001207711621733917999683298965392169896958458913, e=1549488705476755014685333785545000381192222346676781233278311597142241666289339426473410564955539491634817589632730685079191456830106121768568069422532869
The lower 104 bits of p are: 72499552220612223376036046530858764171

extra_info: p=60862701571678301426583540761066111208217872721222493253776029918747002718091, q=112699139773756864851511839539723614929072065480714666558726071569391748391043, Ï†(n)=6859174111435024510253421458680580259305094517098660804606158438592136708158147850343695991487719534678718211481574331795716062523486463290681758207349780
